programme.title: Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show
programme.desc: Welcome to Episode 30 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show presented by Duke Cannon! Adam Lamberti is BACK! He and the boys debate the 2026 #1 pick. Will it be Spanos or will is be Spallina? Adam gives us some more players to look out for heading into next years college season. The boys talk LEGACY, debating which top PLL player and coach needs a championship the most to boost their legacy. Now that Doogs' who should the mvp should've been rankings have come to an end, Kev puts his spin on it. Top 5 VILLAIN rankings. All of this and more on the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show!

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The first open event of the 2004 WSOP would see 834 entrants create a prize pool of over $1.5 million. David "Chip" Reese and Erick Lindgren both fell just short of the final table as the United Kingdom's James Vogl enters the final table as chip leader ahead of J.C. Tran, David Chiu, and Shawn Rice as all eyes are on the $400,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The star-studded final table of the $1,500 Stud would see WSOP bracelet winners Men Nguyen, Ted Forrest, and Minh Nguyen looking to add more WSOP gold to their trophy case. Chad Brown would be eyeing his first WSOP bracelet as $111,440 in first-place prize money was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.desc: The 2021 Poker Masters is underway with Event #1 seeing seven players return and David Peters in control as the chip leader. Peters sits ahead of Brock Wilson, Shannon Shorr, Jonathan Jaffe, Dylan DeStefano, John Riordan, and Ben Yu as they play for the $205,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Sean Perry leads the Event #2 final table while John Riordan returns to sit at his second final table of the series. Also in contention are Jeremy Ausmus, Jake Schindler, Sam Soverel, and Daniel Negreanu as the final six play for the $206,400 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The game changes to Pot-Limit Omaha at the 2021 Poker Masters with Matthew Wantman holding the lead. Chris Brewer, Jake Daniels, Adam Hendrix, Brent Roberts, and Jake Schindler are all in the mix for the $186,300 first-place prize.

programme.desc: Darlene joins Price Warehouse for income; Jackie advances her relationship with Ron and Janelle; Ben alters his appearance for advertisers.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris returns home newly-unemployed; Becky seeks childcare; Jackie advises reaching out to Emilio's family; the family ponders tattoos.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Bev returns, wants to spread happiness with her money. She offers to fund Mark's coding camp tuition, but Darlene suggests giving it to Harris.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan’s ready to share his feelings with Louise; Darlene realizes how badly she wants a baby.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan and Louise deepen their bond amid the challenges of aging; Darlene's night in jail leaves Ben in charge of parenting; Mark's class experiment with a friend results in hickeys.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene and Ben hunt for apartments; Jackie, Becky, and Beverly Rose road trip to Mexico to meet her father; Dan confides financial woes to Louise.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners are dealing with the pandemic and life's financial troubles; the Lunch Box is closed for everything but takeout and delivery.

programme.desc: Mary is devastated that Halloween has been canceled by the city, so Darlene and Becky enlist Jackie and the rest of the family to create an unforgettable experience.

programme.desc: Darlene isolates herself from her co-workers at Wellman Plastics, leaving them with the impression she is an elitist snob.

programme.desc: Darlene's friendship with a manager at Wellman Plastics lands her in an awkward situation; Louise's brother tries to win over Jackie.

programme.desc: Harris's job is in jeopardy after joining a protest she strongly believes in, leading to tense discussions within the family.

programme.desc: Ben's mom arrives after an unexpected death and unveils shocking information from the past; Becky and Emilio spend more time together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene earns a promotion at Wellman Plastics, while Ben decides on a new career path; Jackie tries an herbal tea. and it leads to an emotional revelation.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Chuck's new purchase of a boat creates a rift; Darlene hires her first assistant at Wellman's Plastics but soon realizes she is anything but helpful.

programme.desc: Mark is convinced he has COVID-19; Becky and Harris team up to confront Josh, who has been 'ghosting' Harris.

programme.desc: Dan feels helpless when Louise refuses to let him put himself at risk for her; when Jackie learns the competing restaurants are posting negative reviews.

programme.desc: Dan encounters a surprise visitor who shares some unsolicited advice, leaving him feeling guilty; Darlene welcomes a new employee to Wellman Plastics.

programme.desc: Darlene makes a decision about her trip to Hawaii, leading to a heated encounter with Barb; Becky gives a presentation on addiction to Mark's class.

programme.desc: Two proposals bring big changes to the Conner family; Jackie uses her Jeopardy infamy to her advantage.

programme.desc: The Conners continue to deal with the pandemic while navigating breakups and newfound sobriety, all while planning an upcoming wedding.

programme.desc: After Ben declines Darlene's proposal, she starts to ponder why she tends to be so negative in life, prompting her to start a journey of self-discovery, which leads to Pastor Phil.

programme.desc: It's Dan and Louise's wedding day, but it's a far-from-perfect, especially when a weather report forecasts that a tornado is headed for Lanford creating chaos and surprises.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on how to cut and maintain hedges as well as ideas on growing fruit in pots. Also, Nick Bailey travels to the southern tip of Cornwall to seek out a plant which escaped from our gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets going on a new planting project, gives advice on planting for east- and west- facing borders, starts reaping summer vegetables and sows seeds for autumn harvests. Sue Kent finds inspiration for her own garden when she explores the glorious Aberglasney Gardens in Wales, while Nick Bailey travels to Scotland to investigate a disease which is affecting trees and shrubs in both woodlands and gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty considers a revamp of his cottage garden, divides perennials to get new plants for free and plants bulbs in pots for spring.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Presenting from York Gate in Leeds, Adam Frost, Rachel de Thame and Frances Tophill celebrate a garden for all seasons and tackle a bunch of seasonal jobs for September.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: A catch-up with three sisters in Dorset to discover how their collapsed greenhouse turned into an opportunity to transform part of their garden. Plus, Monty plants garlic and onions, transplants foxgloves, and prepares his strawberry bed for winter.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's apple harvest time, and Monty shares tips on what to do with windfalls before planting a container to give a colourful boost for winter insects. Plus, Adam Frost visits a designer who has overcome extreme weather and difficult terrain.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill is in her new garden and assessing the tomatoes in her upcycled greenhouse, while Rekha Mistry shares the successes and failures of her new vegetable garden. Plus, Errol Reuben Fernandes heads to a contemporary garden in Wakefield.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty replants his bearded iris in the Dry Garden, clears the greenhouse ready for winter salad crops and harvests quince. As part of his Cottage Garden revamp, he transplants a shrub to the orchard and shows how to save money by collecting seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween approaching, Monty takes stock of his pumpkins and squashes, plants up alpines and shows how to divide a large fern to create new plants. Meanwhile, Adam Frost and Advolly Richmond visit Hever Castle in Kent.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Longmeadow is in full bloom, but Monty Don is keen to remind viewers that there is still time to sow some late vegetables, demonstrating how easy it is to grow salad in a pot. It's time to give wisterias their summer prune. An expert, whose 252ft vine was in full flower just weeks ago, shows how she cuts back that summer growth. Meanwhile, Carol Klein has been out and about in Norfolk to revel in the bearded iris.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As roses herald the real arrival of summer, the jewel garden starts to show signs of the abundance of colour that is to come. Monty Don prepares to surround the courtyard garden with scented summer pots.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty begins the process of taking out plants which are in the wrong place and either moving or dividing others. He also gives advice on making leaf mould from fallen leaves and how to use it.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes a look at the use of pots and containers and revels in their versatility, practicality and potential and shows us how best to use them in our own gardens. Carol Klein returns to Stroud to see how the new gardeners are progressing.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the Gardeners' World team look back at the horticultural highlights from the latest series and celebrate the very best inspirational gardens and gardeners up and down the country.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: A celebration of the snowdrop, with a visit one of the world's largest collections, lovingly nurtured in a suburban back garden. Plus, Monty gives tips on what to do once they have finished flowering. Nick Bailey revels in the beauty of magnolias.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Join Adam Frost in his garden, where he will be giving tips on laying turf, planting succulents and adding perennial plants to his kitchen garden to grow as cut flowers. Joe Swift travels to Marwood Hill Gardens in Devon to explore plants that thrive in moist conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has left Longmeadow this week to explore the beautiful gardens at RHS Hyde Hall in Essex. He seeks inspiration from their amazing dry garden and discovers how they manage to keep their lawns looking pristine in such a hot summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty continues with his revamp of the Cottage Garden by planting bare-root roses. Meanwhile, Adam Frost visits a challenging garden built on an exposed slope in the Lake District.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Inherited barn find collection and a wild fiberglass coupe
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets two brothers who just inherited a lifetime collection of eclectic cars. After that, Tom finds an extremely unique fiberglass coupe that once ran on "half of a Deusenberg" engine.

programme.title: Will It Run? | Barn Find 1970 Dodge Challenger T/A 340 Six-Pack
programme.desc: Davin Reckow attempts to bring a long-parked 1970 Dodge Challenger T/A 340 Six-Pack back to life.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Hertz 1966 GT350, and a 700HP Shelby GT500
programme.desc: Shelby expert Colin Comer appraises a 1966 Shelby GT350 Hertz car with a period-correct Paxton Supercharger. And if that's not enough Carroll Shelby for you, Colin checks out a 700HP 1967 Shelby GT500 with TWO Paxton superchargers!

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Will the faded paint on this dusty Ford Wagon shine like new?
programme.desc: Tom Cotter explores a property Midland, Texas, absolutely filled with old cars. An old Ford wagon catches his eye and Tom attempts to cut through the sun-faded, dust-covered quarter panel to reveal its former glory.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Impala, Eagle, Galaxie, Pinto and MORE!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter checks out a 1964 Impala SS, a lifted AMC Eagle 4x4, a 1963 Ford Galaxie 500 Convertible, and some Ford Pinto race cars with SCCA and IMSA race history.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Chris Jacobs' Porsche 911 Targa, a Purple Porsche 930, and a ZL1 Camaro clone
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs stops by to surprise Colin with his ""Daily"" 1985 Porsche 911 Targa and throws Colin for a loop.After that, Colin takes a look at a Porsche 930 Turbo tuned to ""outrun the cops,"" and a ZL1 clone Chevrolet Camaro.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Barn find road trip in a restored Ford Country Squire wagon
programme.desc: After attempting to buff out a dusty fender on a junkyard Ford, Tom Cotter is inspired to clean up the whole car, get it running, and take it on a road trip from Texas to Kansas and find more barn finds along the way!

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | BMW M4 CSL and Range Rover Sport SV Reviews
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the new BMW M4 CSL and the track-ready Range Rover Sport SV.

programme.title: The Next Big Thing with Magnus Walker | Lamborghini Espada, Ferrari 308 GT4, and Dodge Viper
programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drives a Lamborghini Espada and Ferrari 308 GT4 in part one. After that, he jumps in a Dodge Viper. Follow along as he makes the argument as to why these vehicles might be The Next Big Thing in the collector car world

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | World's Fastest V-8 Wagons & Sedans! Plus: 1000+ HP "Mom Missiles"
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Jason Cammisa drag races the world's fastest V-8 wagons and sedans. Next, it's a "Mom Missile" showdown as Jason races 6 of the world's quickest SUVs, including the Gen-2 Rivian R1S Quad, Lucid Gravity Dream Edition and more!

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Lamborghini kit car and basement full of cool cars
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds some interesting cars in the basement of a large house in a residential neighborhood in Southern Utah. Next, Tom is in Georgia where finds a 1965 Ford Fairlane with a 289 V-8 and 4-speed manual transmission.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Tom's Top 10 Barn Finds from the show
programme.desc: Tom Cotter breaks down his "Top 10" barn finds from the show so far, then goes to visit a friend and hears the story of a lost 1967 Austin Mini Cooper S.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Ford Bronco and Chevy C8 Corvette
programme.desc: A first-gen Ford Brono gets the full Chip Foose hot rod treatment.Next, can Chip redesign the new mid-engine C8 Corvette to have a stronger connection to Corvettes of the past?

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Toyota 2000GT and Nissan 240Z
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, host Jason Cammisa dives into the story of Toyota's 2000GT, which was one of the fastest cars in history. Next, Jason gives us the fascinating history behind the Datsun (Nissan) 240Z.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Rolls Royces, Tri-Five Chevys, and vintage Volkswagens
programme.desc: Tom Cotter uncovers 5 Rolls Royces and a huge collection of Buicks in the Appalachian Mountains. Next, it's a stash of Tri-Five Chevrolets, some vintage VWs, and a unique 1930's Dodge sedan.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Aspen F.A.T. Ice Race and a Review of the Audi R8 GT RWD
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole takes us to the F.A.T. Ice Race in Aspen, CO, which must be the coolest car event on the planet. Next, Henry jumps in what could be the last ever V10-powered Audi R8.

programme.title: The Appraiser | 1966 Dodge Charger and 1969 Dodge Coronet Super Bee
programme.desc: Colin has the pleasure of looking over a rust-free 1966 Dodge Charger from the Arizona desert with all the right factory options. Next, Colin appraises a 1969 Dodge Coronet Super Bee that is an all-original California-built car.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay - 2024 Mustang and 1990s Sedans
programme.desc: Race 1: 2024 Mustang Dark Horse vs Lotus Emira, M2, Supra, Camaro, ChallengerRace 2: The Fastest 5-Seaters of the 1990s - W124 500E v RS2 v M5 Touring + ND2

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture with Larry Chen | Amazing JDM cars in Thailand and Japan
programme.desc: Larry Chen travels to Thailand to explore a mansion filled with legendary JDM cars. After that, Larry heads to Japan and the Fuji Speedway to see two amazing Nissan R34 GT-Rs built by Mines and Built By Legends.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Lifetime collection of cars leaves Tom speechless
programme.desc: Tom visits his old friend Dave Coleman who has collected many more "barn finds" on his property since Tom last saw him. Get a tour of Dave's property that's filled with interesting and rare cars.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Low-mileage Buick Grand National and a restoration shop disaster
programme.desc: Tom Cotter starts off this episode finding a stash of cars that includes a 1984 Buick Grand National press car. After that, Tom visits the remains of an amazing Woodie restoration shop that burned completely to the ground.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - '32 Ford and Volvo Amazon
programme.desc: Chip Foose sits down to draw and share his thoughts on how the 1932 Ford Model B design is still relevant today.Next, Chip tweaks the design of a lesser-known European classic: the Volvo Amazon.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Original Big-block Camaros in Arizona
programme.desc: Tom uncovers RS and SS Chevy Camaros in a dusty building in Arizona. These vehicles were eventually purchased and their restoration process has begun, so Tom hops on Zoom with the new owner to see how the projects are going!

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | The World's Best-Sounding Drag Race
programme.desc: Lexus LFA vs Porsche Carrera GT vs Audi RS3The World's Heaviest Supercars square off in this episode of Ultimate Drag Race Replay - with the brand-new, 700-hp Ford F-150 Raptor R racing everything it can.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Greatest Japanese Car Collection in the World, plus a perfect R33 GT-R
programme.desc: Larry Chen has the opportunity to walk through and photography one of the most amazing collections of Japanese cars ever assembled. After that, Larry checks out Mine's and Built by Legends incredible R33 Nissan GT-R.

programme.title: ICONS with Jason Cammisa: Toyota GR 86, and GR Corolla vs. GR Yaris
programme.desc: In this episode of ICONS, host Jason Cammisa reviews the Toyota GR 86 by comparing it to the Mk8 Volkswagen GTI and ND2 Mazda Miata. Next, Jason compares the the wild hot hatches from Toyota: the GR Corolla and the GR Yaris.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | NEW Aston Martin Vantage and DB12
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole drives and reviews the all-new Aston Martin Vantage with it's powerful V-8 engine.Next, Henry drives the all-new DB12, which represents the first of a new generation of the legendary DB nameplate.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Broncos, Galaxies and a lifted Grand Wagoneer
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds all sorts of interesting vehicles on a trip to Northern Michigan, from Ford Broncos to a unique Ford Galaxie. Speaking of Galaxies, hang around for a look at a Galaxie 500 that is back on the road after being a "barn find" itself!

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay - Hyundai Ioniq 5 N vs Super SUVS | Cadillic LeMans race car
programme.desc: Host Jason Cammisa races the Hyundai Ioniq 5 N against the Lamboghini Urus, Porsche Macan GTS, Jaguar F-Pace SVR and Alfa Romeo Grecale Trofeo. Next, he races Cadillac's Le Mans hypercar vs the Ferrari 296, McLaren 750S, and Porsche 911 Turbo S.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - A Cobra Killer and a Time Machine
programme.desc: Designer and hot rodder Chip Foose puts pen to paper and reimagines the oft-forgotten DeTomaso Mangusta.Next, Chip takes a crack at updating certain aspects of a DeLorean DMC-12 in an attempt to give it a more timeless appeal.

programme.title: One Make: Rising Stars in the Racing World | Presented by Mobil 1
programme.desc: One Make gives an unfiltered look at what it’s like to be an up-and-coming driver in the Toyota Gazoo Racing North America GR Cup Series. This episode features Mia Lovell, Westin Workman, Lucas Weisenberg, and Henry Drury.

programme.title: Dream Collections with Chris Jacobs | American Muscle
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs tours two of the most pristine collections of American muscle cars. His first stop is with Rich Fairservis and Garage Town Arizona. After that, Chris meets up with Gary McKay and his immaculate collection of Mustangs, Camaros and more!

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Turner's Auto Wrecking and hidden Porsche 356
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter gets exclusive access to Turner's Auto Wrecking in Fresno, California. After that, he heads high up in the Rocky Mountains of Colorado to discover a Porsche 356 and more.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | BMW vs. Tesla vs. Mercedes! Bentley vs. AMG vs. McLaren!
programme.desc: Jason Cammisa presents TWO episodes of his renowned Ultimate Drag Race Replay series. First, it's BMW M3 CS vs. Tesla Model 3 Performance vs. AMG C63 E Performance. Next , it's the Bentley Continental GT Speed vs. AMG GT63 vs. McLaren GTS.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Muscle Car Dreamland and Elvis' Lincoln Continental
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds a stash of muscle cars in Georgia before discovering an interesting Lincoln Continental that possibly belonged to Elvis Presley.

programme.title: Dream Collections with Chris Jacobs | The Amazing Collections of Harley Cluxton and Tom Malloy
programme.desc: Chris Jacob tours two unbelievable car collections. His first stop is with Harley Cluxton where they drive a Gullwing Mercedes and a Gulf-livery Ford GT. Next, Chris dives into some Indy 500 history with Tom Malloy and his amazing collection.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Cleetus McFarland, Spoon Sorts, and Built By Legends
programme.desc: Larry Chen spends the day with YouTube and motorsport sensation Cleetus McFarland. Next, Larry heads to Spoon Sports to check out their heavily modified Honda Civic EG6.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | The amazing and unusual cars of the Lane Motor Museum
programme.desc: Tom meets up with Jeff Lane to get a private tour of basement collection in the Lane Motor Museum. Next, Tom goes hunting for barn finds near his home in North Carolina.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Porsche Taycan GTS & Volkswagen ID. Buzz Review
programme.desc: Henry drives not one but two Porsches with a GTS badge on the back… and one will surprise you.Next, Henry jumps into the new Volkswagen ID. Buzz van and makes an attempt to turn it into a weekend camper.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Mitsubishi EVO 5, and Secret Car Collections
programme.desc: Larry Chen travels to Indonesia and discovers a unique twin-charged, 600HP Mitsubishi EVO 5. After that, Larry heads to Singapore to check out its vibrant car culture and explore a secret collection of cars spread across several properties.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | RARE Ford Country Squire Wagon & Rust-free finds in Arizona
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds a factory "hot rod" 1 of 1 Ford Country Squire Wagon in suburban Detroit. Next, we find Tom near Lake Havasu in Arizona where the dry weather has been kind to cars left outside for decades.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | BMW E36 M3 and BMW M1
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, host Jason Cammisa tells you why the E36 BMW M3 is the one to have, even without a real M engine. And speaking of M cars... the back half of this episode features the amazing story of the first one, the BMW M1.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 365-ft barn, Jaguar E-Types, and a Vintage SCCA Race Car
programme.desc: Tom meets up with an old friend in South Carolina who shows him a barn full of Jaguars and so much more. Next, Tom travels to New England where he finds a Sunbeam Alpine with SCCA race history and more.

programme.desc: With the help of a friend, Tom discovers a cache of rare and forgotten cars hidden away in Virginia. Next, Tom visits two other friends to check out their interesting collections of cars.

programme.desc: Chip Foose puts pen to paper and reimagines the designs of the Nissan Z, Lamborghini Countrach, and Jeep Cherokee (XJ).

programme.desc: Designer and hot rodder Chip Foose puts pen to paper and reimagines the oft-forgotten DeTomaso Mangusta.Next, Chip takes a crack at updating certain aspects of a DeLorean DMC-12 in an attempt to give it a more timeless appeal.

programme.title: One Make: Rising Stars in the Racing World | Presented by Mobil 1
programme.desc: One Make gives an unfiltered look at what it’s like to be an up-and-coming driver in the Toyota Gazoo Racing North America GR Cup Series. This episode features Mia Lovell, Westin Workman, Lucas Weisenberg, and Henry Drury.

programme.title: Dream Collections with Chris Jacobs | American Muscle
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs tours two of the most pristine collections of American muscle cars. His first stop is with Rich Fairservis and Garage Town Arizona. After that, Chris meets up with Gary McKay and his immaculate collection of Mustangs, Camaros and more!

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Turner's Auto Wrecking and hidden Porsche 356
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter gets exclusive access to Turner's Auto Wrecking in Fresno, California. After that, he heads high up in the Rocky Mountains of Colorado to discover a Porsche 356 and more.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | BMW vs. Tesla vs. Mercedes! Bentley vs. AMG vs. McLaren!
programme.desc: Jason Cammisa presents TWO episodes of his renowned Ultimate Drag Race Replay series. First, it's BMW M3 CS vs. Tesla Model 3 Performance vs. AMG C63 E Performance. Next , it's the Bentley Continental GT Speed vs. AMG GT63 vs. McLaren GTS.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Muscle Car Dreamland and Elvis' Lincoln Continental
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds a stash of muscle cars in Georgia before discovering an interesting Lincoln Continental that possibly belonged to Elvis Presley.

programme.title: Dream Collections with Chris Jacobs | The Amazing Collections of Harley Cluxton and Tom Malloy
programme.desc: Chris Jacob tours two unbelievable car collections. His first stop is with Harley Cluxton where they drive a Gullwing Mercedes and a Gulf-livery Ford GT. Next, Chris dives into some Indy 500 history with Tom Malloy and his amazing collection.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Cleetus McFarland, Spoon Sorts, and Built By Legends
programme.desc: Larry Chen spends the day with YouTube and motorsport sensation Cleetus McFarland. Next, Larry heads to Spoon Sports to check out their heavily modified Honda Civic EG6.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | The amazing and unusual cars of the Lane Motor Museum
programme.desc: Tom meets up with Jeff Lane to get a private tour of basement collection in the Lane Motor Museum. Next, Tom goes hunting for barn finds near his home in North Carolina.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Porsche Taycan GTS & Volkswagen ID. Buzz Review
programme.desc: Henry drives not one but two Porsches with a GTS badge on the back… and one will surprise you.Next, Henry jumps into the new Volkswagen ID. Buzz van and makes an attempt to turn it into a weekend camper.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Mitsubishi EVO 5, and Secret Car Collections
programme.desc: Larry Chen travels to Indonesia and discovers a unique twin-charged, 600HP Mitsubishi EVO 5. After that, Larry heads to Singapore to check out its vibrant car culture and explore a secret collection of cars spread across several properties.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | RARE Ford Country Squire Wagon & Rust-free finds in Arizona
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds a factory "hot rod" 1 of 1 Ford Country Squire Wagon in suburban Detroit. Next, we find Tom near Lake Havasu in Arizona where the dry weather has been kind to cars left outside for decades.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | BMW E36 M3 and BMW M1
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, host Jason Cammisa tells you why the E36 BMW M3 is the one to have, even without a real M engine. And speaking of M cars... the back half of this episode features the amazing story of the first one, the BMW M1.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 365-ft barn, Jaguar E-Types, and a Vintage SCCA Race Car
programme.desc: Tom meets up with an old friend in South Carolina who shows him a barn full of Jaguars and so much more. Next, Tom travels to New England where he finds a Sunbeam Alpine with SCCA race history and more.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Ferrari Dino, AMC Javelin, Buicks and Alfas
programme.desc: With the help of a friend, Tom discovers a cache of rare and forgotten cars hidden away in Virginia. Next, Tom visits two other friends to check out their interesting collections of cars.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Z-Car, Countach, and XJ Jeep Cherokee
programme.desc: Chip Foose puts pen to paper and reimagines the designs of the Nissan Z, Lamborghini Countrach, and Jeep Cherokee (XJ).

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | A Jaguar E-Type story, and What To Do With a Late Friend's Car Collection?
programme.desc: Tom Cotter hears some fun stories from the longtime owner of dilapidated Jaguar E-Type. Next, Tom meets a man who was made executor of his late friend's will. Specifically, he was tasked with managing his unique car collection.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: YOU WON'T BELIEVE WHAT THESE FISH DO!! Dr. Mike Larkin is back! Join us for another exciting dive into the mysterious world of fish and learn some of the most shocking fish facts mother nature has to offer.This week, Dr. Larkin takes us on another exploration of the ocean's hidden wonders, unraveling fascinating insights into fish biology. From species that change gender to surprising revelations about their arterial systems, Dr. Larkin's expertise continues to shed light on these underwater marvels.For those who've followed Dr. Larkin's previous appearances, you already know how much you will get from this interview. And if you're new here, welcome aboard for an underwater adventure that will change the way you think about our finned friends.Don't forget to like, subscribe, and share this mind-blowing episode with fellow fish enthusiasts. Let's plunge into the depths of knowledge together!

programme.desc: A failed playwright returns home to her eccentric mother and a house of full of oddballs in order to get her career, and her life, back on track.

programme.title: Sunshine Cleaning
programme.desc: A single mom-turned-maid gets cash for her kid’s private school and a new lease on life when she enters the lucrative world of crime scene cleanup.

programme.title: Burnt
programme.desc: Intense redemption tale of a cocky, demanding chef recovering from addiction to return as a new restaurant owner to earn his third Michelin Star.

programme.title: Bombshell
programme.desc: The true story of three smart, ambitious women who anchored one of America’s top news networks—and risked it all to stand up to the man who made them.

programme.title: Strange But True
programme.desc: Five years after their son’s death, a family is swept into a dark mystery when his old girlfriend appears to tell them she’s pregnant with his baby.

programme.title: A Murder of Crows
programme.desc: An attorney becomes the FBI's prime suspect when the novel he claims to have written turns out to be a factual account of a series of murders.

programme.title: Reasonable Doubt
programme.desc: A district attorney has his life turned upside down when he's involved in a hit and run and another man is arrested for his crime.

programme.title: Hard Candy
programme.desc: Tables are turned on a predator when he unwittingly engages in a game of cat and mouse with a teenage girl.

programme.title: The Poison Rose
programme.desc: A private eye returns to his Texas hometown to track down a missing heiress, where he confronts a dangerous doctor, his ex, and his own dark past.

programme.title: Come and Find Me
programme.desc: Aaron Paul ("Breaking Bad") gets caught in the dangerous criminal underworld as he searches for his girlfriend, who's mysteriously disappeared.

programme.title: Strange But True
programme.desc: Five years after their son’s death, a family is swept into a dark mystery when his old girlfriend appears to tell them she’s pregnant with his baby.

programme.title: Ladyhawke
programme.desc: A medieval pickpocket who escapes the noose becomes indebted to a shapeshifting knight and his star-crossed lover on a revenge quest to kill a bishop.

programme.title: Pleasantville
programme.desc: Two teens are transported into the black-and-white world of a 1950s sitcom.

programme.title: Who's That Girl?
programme.desc: A woman sets off on a madcap quest to find the person guilty of the crime for which she served the time.

programme.title: Vision Quest
programme.desc: A gentle but driven 18-year-old underdog toils against the odds to become Washington state’s top wrestler while winning the heart of a young drifter.

programme.title: Stand and Deliver
programme.desc: A true story about a teacher and the unmotivated East Los Angeles high school students who he inspires, badgers, and humors into learning calculus.

programme.title: Lean on Me
programme.desc: Morgan Freeman is a controversial educator battling for his high school.

programme.title: Up the Academy
programme.desc: Four young slackers meet when they are sent to a military academy.

programme.title: Message in a Bottle
programme.desc: A lonely woman's discovery of a man's letter in a bottle leads to love.

programme.title: Surf Ninjas
programme.desc: Two surfer dudes discover they are princes of a small South Pacific island and are destined to save their native land from a cruel despot.

programme.title: Spies Like Us
programme.desc: Two complete misfits aspire to spy for the CIA.

programme.title: Monkey Trouble
programme.desc: Eva's (Thora Birch) mom (Mimi Rodgers) is obsessively neat; her dad's (Christopher McDonald) allergic to fur. But when a thieving organ grinder's (Harvey Keitel) monkey escapes, Eva bonds with a new friend. As much as she tries, Eva can't housebreak her new pet ... or break him of his training to steal. And Eva's getting the blame in this heartwarming family comedy.

programme.title: One Crazy Summer
programme.desc: During a summer in Nantucket, a recent high school grad with dreams of being a cartoonist helps a young singer save her family home from developers.

programme.title: Drop Dead Gorgeous
programme.desc: The battle between the good and the bad is bound to get ugly.

programme.title: Home Fries
programme.desc: A pregnant worker at a fast-food joint becomes the irresistible target of a young man, whose homicidal family wants her dead.

programme.title: The Hudsucker Proxy
programme.desc: When the founder of a large corporation suddenly dies, the board conspires to tank the stock price by installing a lowly mailroom clerk as president.

programme.title: The 6th Day
programme.desc: In the future, a corporation has begun illegally cloning humans. They mistakenly clone the wrong man, who is now the only one who could expose them.

programme.title: The Other Boleyn Girl
programme.desc: Based on the best-selling novel, The Other Boleyn Girl is a captivating tale of intrigue, romance and betrayal about two sisters who rival for the bed and heart of King Henry VIII.

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: The Jane Austen classic portrays two sisters, one pragmatic, the other overly emotional, who both fall in love with men who are promised to others.

programme.title: Surrender, Dorothy
programme.desc: Hoping to learn more about her daughter Sara after her sudden death, Natalie retreats to the beach house where Sara's friends are summering.

programme.title: Sister Mary Explains It All
programme.desc: A confrontation between three former students and a nun forever changes their lives as the students turn the dogmatic nun's teachings on their head.

programme.title: Like Father, Like Son
programme.desc: A workaholic heart surgeon accidentally ingests a brain-transference serum, causing him to switch bodies with his laid-back teenage son.

programme.title: Nadine
programme.desc: While recovering sexy photos of herself from a dishonest photographer, a woman witnesses a murder and finds herself at the center of a conspiracy.

programme.title: The First Time
programme.desc: What begins as a casual chat turns into something more complex, as a romance blooms between a high school junior and a senior on his way to college.

programme.title: To Write Love on Her Arms
programme.desc: Based on the life of Renee Yohe, who battled drugs, depression, and issues, that led to the founding of the charity group To Write Love on Her Arms.

programme.title: Peggy Sue Got Married
programme.desc: An unhappy woman named Peggy Sue tries to change her future when she inadvertently travels back in time to her senior year of high school.

programme.title: Whatever It Takes
programme.desc: A romantic teen comedy about the lengths that people will go to land their ideal partner—only to discover that reality doesn't live up to the fantasy.

programme.title: The Razor's Edge
programme.desc: A WWI veteran is disillusioned by jazz-age values. He breaks off his engagement and goes on a journey that takes him through Paris and the Himalayas.

programme.title: Punchline
programme.desc: Steve, a broke stand-up comedian, develops a friendship and mentorship with Lilah, a homemaker with an ambition to be a stand-up comedian.

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Pierre Bouelle novel about POWs in Burma forced to build a bridge to aid the war effort of their Japanese captors. British and American officers plot to blow up the structure, but the commander of the bridge's construction has different plans.

programme.title: Anatomy of a Murder
programme.desc: Semi-retired Michigan lawyer Paul Biegler (James Stewart) takes the case of Army Lt. Manion (Ben Gazzara), who murdered a local innkeeper after his wife (Lee Remick) claimed that he raped her. Over the course of an extensive trial, Biegler parries with District Attorney Lodwick (Brooks West) and out-of-town prosecutor Claude Dancer (George C. Scott) to set his client free, but his case rests on the victim's mysterious business partner (Kathryn Grant), who's hiding a dark secret.

programme.title: Only Angels Have Wings
programme.desc: Rough and tough Geoff Carter (Cary Grant) runs a tiny airline that cannot afford to miss any flights, despite the dangers along many of the routes. When Bonnie Lee (Jean Arthur), a performer who is falling for him, sees that Geoff is preparing to fly in violent weather conditions, she takes measures to make him stay. She's successful in her attempt, and two of his employees are forced to make the flight for him -- but Bonnie may have been correct about the potential peril of that flight.

programme.title: Born Free
programme.desc: An English couple in Kenya raises an orphaned lion cub to adulthood. When a warden demands she be sent to a zoo, they train her to live in the wild.

programme.title: Eight Iron Men
programme.desc: In this psychological war drama, the nerves of eight men wear thin, as they are pinned down for 17 days under heavy bombardment during World War II.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: This steamy pot-boiler follows the intrigues surrounding an escaped convict who attempts to return to the small southern town where he grew up.

programme.title: The Fuller Brush Man
programme.desc: Clumsy sanitation worker Red Jones (Red Skelton) is fired from his street-cleaning job shortly after his girlfriend, Ann Elliot (Janet Blair), refuses his marriage proposal until he betters himself. While training to become a door-to-door salesman, he accidentally stumbles into a murder investigation when the corrupt sanitation commissioner (Nicholas Joy) who had fired him is killed. When the murder weapon is found to be one of the brushes Red sells, he must fight to prove his innocence.

programme.title: Where Angels Go...Trouble Follows
programme.desc: A bus trip for the girls of St. Francis Academy in Pennsylvania takes a radical detour on its way to an interfaith youth rally in California.

programme.title: The Bedford Incident
programme.desc: Reporter Ben Munceford (Sidney Poitier) is aboard a U.S. Navy ship sailing near the Arctic Circle, on assignment to write a profile of Capt. Eric Finlander (Richard Widmark), a hardened anti-communist. Despite the concerns of Munceford, medical officer Chester Potter (Martin Balsam) and others on the ship, Finlander is shadowing a Soviet submarine on patrol in the same area, hoping to make it to surface. The cat-and-mouse game, however, turns deadly serious.

programme.title: All Ashore
programme.desc: When they finally get some shore leave, three sailors head to Catalina Island and try to meet girls while pretending to be entertainers.

programme.title: Scandal Sheet
programme.desc: After accidentally killing his ex-wife, an editor of a tabloid newspaper discovers that his ace reporters are investigating the story.

programme.title: Run Wild, Run Free
programme.desc: A mute boy who spends his days roaming the English countryside starts coming out of his shell when he befriends a wild pony and a retired colonel.

programme.title: Our Wife
programme.desc: A composer (Melvyn Douglas) goes on a cruise and meets a woman (Ruth Hussey) he likes more than his wife (Ellen Drew).

programme.title: The Admirable Crichton
programme.desc: A butler becomes a king after a shipwreck.

programme.title: The Longest Drive
programme.desc: After a decade apart, a pair of brothers reunites to find their long-lost sister, who was kidnapped as a child and is now living with a native tribe.

programme.title: Lust for Gold
programme.desc: During the 1870s, the ruthless Jacob Walz (Glenn Ford) becomes very wealthy after locating a legendary Arizona gold mine and securing sole ownership by murdering his partner. Walz then travels to Phoenix, where he catches the attention of a beautiful and crafty woman named Julia Thomas (Ida Lupino), who has learned of his exploits. Eventually, Walz falls in love with Julia, unaware that she's already married to Pete (Gig Young), who is eyeing his fortune.

programme.title: Thomasine & Bushrod
programme.desc: In this beloved Blaxploitation flick set in 1911, a team of thieves steal from wealthy capitalists, to return their riches to deserving families.

programme.title: The Shadow Riders
programme.desc: Two brothers return home after the Civil War to find that their family has been kidnapped by a marauding band of rebel Confederate guerrillas.

programme.title: Ridin' for Justice
programme.desc: A popular cowboy (Buck Jones) takes the blame for the death of a deputy who tried to force himself on the marshal's wife.

programme.title: The Man From Colorado
programme.desc: In Colorado at the end of the Civil War, Col. Owen Devereaux (Glenn Ford), affected by four years of brutal bloodshed, orders the massacre of a Confederate unit, even as they try to surrender. Devereaux's friend and second in command, Capt. Del Stewart (William Holden), is the only one aware of the surrender attempt. Devereaux returns home to a hero's welcome and is appointed a judge, yet his irrational and angry behavior continues, affecting his fianceé, Caroline (Ellen Drew), as well as Del.

programme.title: The Man From Laramie
programme.desc: Will Lockhart (James Stewart) comes to the ranch town of Coronado looking for the man who is selling rifles to the Apaches, because his brother was killed with one. There he runs into Alec Waggoman (Donald Crisp), an aging rancher with a violent son named Dave (Alex Nicol). A conflict between Dave and Vic (Arthur Kennedy), Waggoman's top aid, helps Lockhart uncover the source of the rifles -- and also gets him involved in the power struggles at the Waggoman ranch.

programme.title: Saddles and Sagebrush
programme.desc: A rancher (Russell Hayden) joins an outlaw gang to figure out how to stop it.

programme.title: The Rough, Tough West
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) looks for his friend Big Jack (Jack Mahoney) and finds out that Jack is illegally commandeering the mines and claims of others.

programme.title: Buchanan Rides Alone
programme.desc: Journeying from Mexico back home to West Texas, mercenary Tom Buchanan (Randolph Scott) takes a break for the night in the border town of Agry. He soon discovers that almost every resident -- from the crooked sheriff (Barry Kelley) to the shifty-eyed innkeeper -- is a member of the prominent Agry family. When Buchanan defends Juan de la Vega (Manuel Rojas), a young man about to be lynched for shooting the town drunk, he himself is accused of murder and must struggle to escape town alive.

programme.title: Jesse James vs. the Daltons
programme.desc: An outcast rumored to be the son of notorious outlaw Jesse James makes contact with the Dalton gang in hopes of learning the truth about his lineage.

programme.title: The Kid From Broken Gun
programme.desc: After years on the East Coast, former boxer Jack Mahoney (Jack Mahoney) returns to New Mexico and finds himself framed for murder. Though the only evidence is circumstantial, in the face of vicious prosecutor Kiefer (Myron Healey), Mahoney's girlfriend -- defense lawyer Gail Kingston (Angela Stevens) -- fails to convince the jury of his innocence. Determined to clear Mahoney's name, postal worker Steve Reynolds (Charles Starrett) transforms himself into the masked rider known as the Durango Kid.

programme.title: Laramie Mountains
programme.desc: The Durango Kid learns that crooked scouts are behind attempts to escalate a war between a local tribe and the cavalry.

programme.title: Mackenna's Gold
programme.desc: Apaches, townsfolk, a Mexican bandit (Omar Sharif) and the cavalry follow a sheriff (Gregory Peck) to a mythical canyon of gold.

programme.title: Renegades
programme.desc: Hannah Brockway (Evelyn Keyes) has a perfect fiancé in Dr. Sam Martin (Willard Parker). Sam, who is respected by Hannah's family, is a noble man who cares for her and can make a good living in their frontier town. Yet Hannah craves adventure and finds it when she meets dashing Ben Dembrow (Larry Parks), the youngest of a notorious crime family. Together Ben and Hannah set off to forge a new life, but prejudice and strangling family ties soon bring trouble to these newlyweds.

programme.title: Santa Fe
programme.desc: Three brothers become outlaws after the Civil War, while a fourth sibling goes to work for the railroad.

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four soldiers of fortune are hired by a wealthy rancher to rescue his beautiful young wife who has been kidnapped by a villainous Mexican bandit. When they finally find her, after fighting their way across deserts and mountains, they discover she is not being held against her will. This causes friction within the band as to whether they should honor their agreement.

programme.title: A Night At The Opera
programme.desc: A seedy theatrical agent guarantees a patron a position in high society if she bankrolls an opera, but only if he manages to sign a famous tenor.

programme.title: Manpower
programme.desc: Two best friends get tangled up in jealousy and betrayal after they both fall for the same nightclub hostess.

programme.title: Jim Thorpe: All American
programme.desc: The famous athlete fights prejudice in his pursuit of sports stardom.

programme.title: Knute Rockne All American
programme.desc: Biography of the Notre Dame coach's fight to "win one for the Gipper."

programme.title: The In-Laws (1979)
programme.desc: The father of the groom drags the bride's father into madcap adventures.

programme.title: Logan's Run
programme.desc: In a dystopian world where people face mandatory death at the age of 30, an elite police officer is tasked with hunting down those who try to escape.

programme.title: The Last Run (1971)
programme.desc: A retired Chicago getaway driver living in Portugal decides to come out of retirement for one last run.

programme.title: The Devil's Brother
programme.desc: Laurel and Hardy bumble their way into the heart of a classic comic opera filled with fearsome bandits.

programme.title: Mutiny on the Bounty (1962)
programme.desc: Marlon Brando stars as a first mate who leads his ship's exploited and abused crew through mutiny.

programme.title: The Crimson Pirate
programme.desc: A pirate gets mixed up in a Caribbean revolution.

programme.title: Dodge City
programme.desc: Because someone’s gotta do it, a Texas cattleman takes on the task of cleaning up the wild and lawless Dodge City while courting one of its women.

programme.title: They Won't Believe Me
programme.desc: A faithless husband is charged with a murder he didn't commit.

programme.title: The Tender Trap
programme.desc: A swinging bachelor finds love when he meets a girl immune to his line.

programme.title: Seven Brides for Seven Brothers
programme.desc: A bride attempts to turn her six brothers-in-law into gentlemen.

programme.title: Take Me Out to the Ball Game
programme.desc: A beautiful woman takes over a turn-of-the-century baseball team.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarret and Catherine meet a boy whose father is missing and could be in grave danger.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When a professor is murdered, his boss, his teaching assistant and a student all come under suspicion.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When Chin is kidnapped and left in Halawa prison dressed as an inmate, he must escape before the other prisoners recognize him.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The night before an election, the governor asks the team to investigate when a prostitute is found dead in a missing congressman's bed; Danny waits for a custody decision.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A double amputee (Peter Weller) goes after the police officers responsible for his injuries -- including McGarrett.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a Lua master; McGarrett has a private investigator tail his mother.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Danny obsesses about the big game during all-pro weekend in Hawaii; a star football player helps the team investigate the murder of a tech executive.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When a murder victim lands in Dog the Bounty Hunter's vehicle, Catherine goes under cover and investigates at a local roller derby.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team struggles to narrow down a suspect when threats against a company that endangers sharks turn deadly; Kamekona tries to earn his helicopter license.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett tells the story of his last mission in North Korea as he and Catherine cross into the country to retrieve a friend's remains.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When a Marine recruiter is murdered, the team delves into the world of military enlistment to try to find the killer; Natalia must face her ex-husband when he asks out one of her co-workers.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team must find a suspected terrorist, who goes on the run after a failed attempt on her life.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio, the lab's night shift and Calleigh's ex-boyfriend must find evidence that proves Natalia's innocence when she is accused of her ex-husband's murder.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and the bomb squad must defuse a land mine before it detonates; Delko is sued for his role in a domestic dispute.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: On the eve of his wedding to Rita -- and Connor leaving for the Witness Protection Program -- Pride must track down who attacked Jimmy and Connor, while he navigates Sasha's ulterior motives regarding her son.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a petty officer whom Pride had mentored; Brody searches for a place to call home.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a Navy lieutenant on liberty dies of bubonic plague, NCIS Special Agent Tony DiNozzo helps the New Orleans team as they try to control a potential outbreak and find the source of the infectious disease.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: An armored transport bus crashes, resulting in the escape of four prisoners -- including a black market broker topping the list of national security threats; Pride needs Gibbs' help with a case file full of redactions.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a Navy SEAL is found dead in a sorority house, the team must determine if his death was related to collegiate foul play or a classified mission; Pride's daughter visits the office.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The investigation into a chief warrant officer's death reveals that his wife has been abducted -- leaving the team with a 22-hour deadline; senior FBI agent Fornell assists with the case.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Amidst Halloween festivities in New Orleans, a Naval Staff Judge Advocate dressed in a costume is found dead in a cemetery; the team debates Halloween costumes and activities.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigate the murder of a Navy Officer assigned as a tech liaison with a private developer; Pride turns the carport into an auto shop.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A murdered petty officer -- with a proposal and an engagement ring -- is found in a Mardi Gras float storage facility; the members of the team are baffled when they cannot locate the victim's girlfriend.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team reopens a cold case when a stolen Navy-issue gun turns out to belong to a chief petty officer who died 40 years ago; the team makes their annual Thanksgiving dinner together.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A retired SEAL -- who tracked people impersonating military personnel -- is murdered; Brody finds that LaSalle is uncharacteristically unenthusiastic about Christmas.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The investigation into an explosion at the Navy-Marine Corp Relief Gala reveals Pride was the bomb's target.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The NCIS team and the Coast Guard Investigative Service work together when a Navy Admiral's daughter is the prime suspect in a double murder on a research boat; Lasalle looks for his estranged brother.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After learning he was poisoned with a deadly dose of radiation, a Navy lieutenant commander asks Pride and the team to solve his imminent murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the village of Broughton, a ninety-year-old battle of the sexes has often occurred, with men trying to oppose an event that the women have managed to successfully hold without interruption, until it culminates with casualties on both sides - Mildred Danvers, an elderly woman who had returned on the day of a funeral and poisoned in her hotel room, and Rev. Anthony Gant, shot during a major event being held in the village green, in view of many. It soon becomes clear someone may have wished to kill both to cover up a dark truth, and soon Barnaby has to figure out who amongst the village wanted both dead, complicated further when Gant's curate is murdered next.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Villagers in Elverton-cum-Latterly are up in arms and divided, over the building of a supermarket. Things soon come to a head when independent environmental supervisor, Frank Hopkirk, is found stabbed to death at a Jubb's Timber Yard, the site of the new supermarket, by a pair of children. When Barnaby and Jones investigate to determine who wanted Hopkirk dead, they find out that he secretly came to the village under various aliases for sexual rendezvous with various women in fantasy role-playing scenarios, and that he had been making further investigations on the future development site and having doubts over claims it was contaminated. Either someone didn't like his investigations, or someone didn't like his sexual appetite, but either way, Barnaby finds himself investigating lies and more to uncover the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and DC Ben Jones (Jason Hughes) find themselves attempting to unravel the deaths of a choir tenor, and later a bird watcher, before more murders occur. The case is complicated by a rivalry between the Midsomer Worthy and Aston Wherry choirs, due to compete in an upcoming competition, and suspicions that an art scam is to be conducted, and soon Barnaby and Jones become concerned about a local woman, who they fear may become a victim herself. Particularly when it becomes clear the bird watcher had been photographing suspicious activity of late.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A few months ago, Annie Woodrow was arrested, accused of murdering her friend, Frances Trevelyan, on the motive of wanting Frances' husband. Her time in court has come, but DCI Barnaby is certain she still is holding things back in regards to the murder, and decides to monitor the trial. Yet a chance remark by Frances' youngest daughter, and a meeting with an old friend and psychiatrist, makes him begin to doubt the evidence for her conviction. Soon he and DC Jones, awaiting news of his promotion to DS, find themselves reinvestigating the case, and it soon becomes clear that they may have missed details that could implicate another in the murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The unveiling of a newly-discovered novel by deceased Midsomer crime-writer George Summersbee at the Luxton Deeping Crime Festival is jeopardised when the manuscript is stolen and a woman is fatally electrocuted by a booby-trapped roulette wheel. Can new dad Barnaby untangle a web of jealousy and obsession to find the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a pub landlady is crushed to death during a magic show in Midsomer Oaks, Barnaby and Nelson uncover conflict between the village church and ancient pagan traditions. Is famous magician Gideon Latimer to blame or is he the target?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Could a ballad made famous by late, lamented folk singer Johnny Carver be an inspiration for murder? Did someone want to kill Toby Winning for threatening to take the Little Crosby Folk Festival away from Midsomer - or is the true motive something hidden for 20 years?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The fizz goes out of a sparkling wine launch when the glasses are laced with slug poison. Who is targeting the Midsomer Vinae Winery and what does the attack have to do with the death of a child in a hit-and-run accident?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's Christmas and new detective Charlie Nelson moves into Midsomer. He's thrown straight into an intriguing mystery in the village of Morton Shallows. A man is fatally stabbed with an antique sword during a ghost-hunting party at a "haunted" manor house. Can Barnaby and Nelson find a more earthly motive behind the murder and trap the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A series of murders in Midsomer St Claire seem to be inspired by macabre images on a medieval fresco recently discovered in the church crypt. As the village prepares for storms and flooding it appears that someone is using ancient torture methods to punish modern-day "sinners". But who is responsible and why?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When wealthy farmer Martin Strickland is covered in truffle oil and mauled to death by a wild boar, the investigation leads to restaurant Wyvern House and its tyrannical celebrity chef Ruth Cameron. Secrets from the past surface and the killer strikes again - but the poison spreads wider than its intended target.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a body is discovered in a reservoir dropped out of a plane, Barnaby and Nelson find the world of stunt pilots and military heroes hides many dark secrets. Are campaigners against the local airfield behind Bernard King's murder or does it link back to a tragic story from World War Two?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the boss of Calder's Biscuit Company is murdered in Copenhagen, Barnaby and Nelson join forces with two female Danish detectives, the abrasive and astute Poulsen and the charming and cool Degn. They discover Eric Calder had more linking him to Copenhagen than just his famous Golden Clusters.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A disused airfield near Morton Fendle is the location for a romantic evening between young Simon Bright and his girlfriend Laura Sharp - absolutely nothing could ruin their date. The next morning, when Frances Kirby is out for her morning jog, she notices the vintage car they were in up at the airfield, containing Simon Bright's dead body, with Laura nowhere to be seen. Confused, Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby and D.S. Jones can't work out whether it was a suicide pact or murder. Furthermore, they've got to find Miss Sharp and their investigation leads them to linking Simon and Laura with the villagers of Morton Fendle, who met at Elaine Trim's dancing classes. Eventually, the Barnaby family plus Jones make it to a 40s style dance night at the village hall before more villagers start turning up dead.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Faith Alexander arrives in Midsomer County to meet her long-lost uncle Rex Masters, she gets a shock - Rex's staff had been told that she was dead. Things become even more complex when Rex's body is found in a nearby river, bearing wounds that suggest he was murdered. Barnaby and Jones are soon on the case, trying to establish who would have wanted the elderly man dead. Several people soon come forward with multiple wills, which confuse the matter, but when two more people, close friends of Rex, are also murdered, the investigation raises question on the motive, leading Barnaby to wonder if it was down to finances, passion, or something from Rex's past.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the death of Alan King while on a business trip to China, the family company, King's Crystal, is in financial trouble. As plans to shut the Midsomer Magna factory are being put into action, Alan's wife Hilary and brother Charles are married in the village church - much to the dismay of Alan's son Ian. In addition to strife between members of the family, the factory workers are outraged at the loss of their jobs. So when company accountant Peter Baxter is found murdered, Barnaby and Jones suspect a disgruntled employee is to blame. But in order to investigate the matter further, Jones is forced to work undercover, and infiltrate the local group of Freemasons in the village.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The music lovers of Midsomer County are delighted when a host of bands arrives for the Midsomer Rocks festival. Barnaby himself is particularly looking forward to seeing recently re-formed rock band, Hired Gun, perform on stage, but he soon gets close to the band for rather unfortunate reasons. During their opening performance, the band's singer, Mimi (Suzi Quatro), falls to the ground dead - electrocuted by a wire that had been run through the microphone stand. Barnaby and Jones soon find the rest of the band could be targets, and when another is killed, questions are raised as to whether former band member, Ginger Foxton, who went missing for 30 years and is presumed dead, is still at large. The detectives soon have to delve into a world of rock music, drug use and greed, to find the truth.

programme.desc: The team travels to Utah for a rare shot at a 19th century Hotchkiss Revolving Cannon; an antique Wurlitzer jukebox grooves its way into the shop; a woman comes in hoping to sell her antique medical quackery device.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawn shop heats up after Corey spends big bucks buying a huge 12 passenger hot air balloon--and at the same time breaking one of Rick's golden rules.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars are presented with the opportunity to add one of the world's most recognizable trophies to their collection--a Grammy. Will the gang put up the cash to get the gold or will the deal hit a sour note and be taken off the charts?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars have a chance to buy a saddle that may have been used by Kevin Costner in Dances with Wolves. Will the gang pony-up and make the deal or will they let it ride off into the sunset?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out a jetpack from the Gemini space program; a Snoopy comic book with a personal drawing from Charles Schulz; Rick's take on a commercial for the pawn shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A pair of rifles with double rotating barrels; Corey and Chumlee check out a pair of cleats worn by Yankees legend Bucky Dent; Chumlee breaks the coffee machine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick tries to refurbish a 1950's coke machine into a modernized collector's item. Will his plan quench his thirst or fizzle out and go flat? Meanwhile, Corey is offered an old pirate favorite: an 18th Century flintlock pistol.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An 1830s musket made by Eli Whitney shoots into the shop; a man brings in a golf ball once owned by President Lyndon B. Johnson; a man comes into the shop with a 1929 Chicago Cubs World Series press pin.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Roar down the road with the Pawn Stars as they stumble upon a Down and Dirty custom motorcycle frame.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and the Old Man look to buy a 1965 Shelby Cobra classic car--one of the most expensive American race cars.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars have an opportunity to buy something they've never bought before--a helicopter! Can Rick convince the Old Man to come along and spin up a deal? Then Rick has a chance to buy a 240-year-old lottery ticket.

programme.title: Pawn Stars

programme.title: Dance Moms

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Ekstensive turns a stock 2020 Denali dually into a frame-dropping, show-stopping work truck; as a final touch, Bill handmakes articulating speakers for the bed; Bill takes a family's minds off their brush with a custom 2019 Polaris Ranger.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The guys bring a 1964 Lincoln back with a late-model Coyote engine and handmade interior; the Sling-Ray is a custom automotive sensation, but Ekstensive has what it's been missing.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1971 Suburban returns to the shop for "phase two," wanting more power and custom metalwork; when a client finds parts and pieces of a '68 C10, Bill and the crew set on a new course for a ground-up build.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill gets déjà vu on a 1985 Chevy C10 square body; a handmade chassis; after a close call, Ekstensive makes a 1923 T-Bucket street safe.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Rocker Ted Nugent brings in his beloved '74 Bronco; Bill and the guys make an all-terrain beast unlike any other; With his creative sparks flying, Bill gets going on a build he's dreamed about for years: a handmade, all-tube, off-road buggy.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A local client wants the teams help to surprise his dad with a custom 1946 Ford Coupe; Bill goes for a mix of both classy and supercharged when working on his wife's 2021 Escalade.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Ekstensive needs a new shop truck, Bill and the guys go sky-high with a lifted '21 F-450 King Ranch capable of hauling over 20,000 pounds; with most of the '46 Ford Coupe body beyond repair, the team has no choice but to build from the ground up.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The guys hit the home stretch on the '46 Ford Blue Thunder, its once-rusted shell now rebuilt into a one-of-one showstopper; Bill is surprised when John Cena drops off a '69 MGC.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill and the gang split a nearly perfect 1960 Willys Jeep into four pieces to make it longer, wider and meaner.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: After John Cena makes a surprise appearance at the shop, Bill and the guys begin to customize John's small 1969 MGC to be a perfect fit; a new customer wants a handmade lifted suspension on his 1920 Denali 2500 as a gift for his wife.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill is still being put to the test with a 1928 Ford Rat Rod, a 1942 Ford pickup and a 1975 C10.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill has never really liked the body of the 1974 Cadillac Eldorado, but when a client wants hers radically redesigned, Ekstensive blends old and new to make it cooler than the rest.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill and the team work their magic to customize a brand-new 2022 International wrecker; now that the pristine 1960s Willys Jeep has been quartered, they use imaginative fabrication techniques to make it whole again.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: An Ekstensive favorite, a 2001 Hummer H1, needs some serious reinforcements; Bill changes things up on his completely custom, all-tube buggy by borrowing technology from monster trucks; Bill puts his daughter to work customizing her 2020 Challenger.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Actor John Cena is amazed by the transformation of his British classic '69 MGC into a custom-built masterpiece with all-American trimmings; the team has to get creative building a chassis and bed for a '60s Jeep Willys entirely from scratch.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The Mecum Auction comes to town, and Bill runs four vehicles across the block with shocking results. The team starts their next monster build, a custom all-tube buggy. Building an indestructible cage requires all their fabrication skills and then some!

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The hometown Houston Astros ask for a custom van that brings the party.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A '68 C10 gets over-the-top fabrication and an epoxy river bed.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill refuses to hold anything back as the '68 C10 finishes in a flourish.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The team custom builds every part for the heavy-duty, 1,500-hp buggy.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A pristine '60s Willys transforms into something bigger, meaner and louder.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill and team go big with an antique '53 tanker and small with a golf cart.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The crew takes a fully customized '37 Ford Coupe back to the factory look.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A '64 Rolls-Royce has a rusty secret, and the '53 tanker is almost done.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The team turns an F-350 into a Baja-style Raptor and rebuilds a '64 Rolls.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The team upgrades a '72 'Cuda's interior and tears down a '52 GMC wrecker.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill wakes up his F-150 race truck, and the wrecker gets new suspension.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A '22 Ford Lighting becomes the shop's first all-electric custom air ride.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Builds include a smashed '22 Gladiator and a Polaris Ranger side-by-side.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill goes back to his roots building mini-trucks with a 2023 Polaris Ranger, adding a custom camper and dancing bed; Ekstensive has built its share of ground-up builds over the years, but nothing like the metalwork on the 1952 Wrecker.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: What was already one of Ekstensive's biggest ground-up builds ever goes even bigger on the '52 tow truck, as Bill and his team fabricate a custom hot rod wrecker truck unlike any other; the team takes the stock out of a 2023 GMC Denali.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: John Cena surprises the shop with parts of an iconic '37 Bugatti Type 57; it's Bill's turn to surprise John with an audacious design choice; a stock '23 GMC Denali goes bigger, badder and dually.

programme.title: Unique Rides
programme.desc: Will Castro and Team Unique work overtime to bring out the sexy in singer/dancer Jason Derulo's Cadillac Escalade.

programme.title: Unique Rides
programme.desc: Will Castro tackles hip-hop recording artist Busta Rhymes' tired tour bus, then races the clock to finish work on NFL star Odell Beckham Jr.'s treasured Mercedes-Benz.
